pr_title: Accelerate two-dimensional new array with second dimension being zero

timeline.message:
Use MVHI to store constants

Signed-off-by: Dhruv Chopra <Dhruv.C.Chopra@ibm.com>

-Remove unnecessary LR instructions.
-Add assert to make sure elementSize <= 8
-Add assert for discontiguousArrayHeaderSizeInBytes == 16
-Use OMR::align API to do element alignment
-Remove use of performHelperCall routine

Signed-off-by: Dhruv Chopra <Dhruv.C.Chopra@ibm.com>

Address PR change requests

-Remove unnecessary LR instructions.
-Add assert to make sure elementSize <= 8
-Add assert for discontiguousArrayHeaderSizeInBytes == 16
-Use OMR::align API to do element alignment
-Remove use of performHelperCall routine

Signed-off-by: Dhruv Chopra <Dhruv.C.Chopra@ibm.com>

timeline.bodyText: Do we need this? Can't we just use AssertJUnit.assertEquals which is much more standard and pretty prints everything for us already.
timeline.author: fjeremic

replies.bodyText:
I don't think this provides anything we need specifically, but this is the convention used throughout the other tests in this directory. We use this convention to add the test names inside testng.xml as well. So I think if we want to change it here, we should do it for all the other tests as well.
@llxia Can you confirm or deny this? I might be missing something here.
replies.author: dchopra001

replies.bodyText: jit.test.jitt.Test is not needed for testng. The entry in testng.xml is the class name of the test <class name="jit.test.jitt.array.multianewarray"/>. If we do not need anything from jit.test.jitt.Test, we do not need to extend the class.
replies.author: llxia

replies.bodyText: Thank you for the explanation. I've removed the class extension here: 51ffa13
replies.author: dchopra001

Brace styles should match that of VM Java code (tabs, braces in Java style, etc.). See:
https://github.com/dchopra001/openj9/blob/arrayDim-Final/test/functional/JIT_Test/src/jit/test/recognizedMethod/TestRecognizedCallTransformer.java
as an example.

timeline.message:
Newline and formatting changes

Signed-off-by: Dhruv Chopra <Dhruv.C.Chopra@ibm.com>

Rewrite multianewarray evaluator on Z

This commit adds support for 2-dimensional arrays
where the second dimension has length=0 in the
multianewarrayEvaluator. Additionally, some new tests
are also added to test this functionality.

Signed-off-by: Dhruv Chopra <Dhruv.C.Chopra@ibm.com>

are also added to test this functionality.

https://ci.eclipse.org/openj9/job/Test_openjdk8_j9_sanity.functional_ppc64_aix_Personal_testList_1/95/console

timeline.message:
Rewrite multianewarray evaluator on Z

This commit adds support for 2-dimensional arrays
where the second dimension has length=0 in the
multianewarrayEvaluator. Additionally, some new tests
are also added to test this functionality.

Signed-off-by: Dhruv Chopra <Dhruv.C.Chopra@ibm.com>
